meanings.definition: A unit of currency in several countries in the Middle East and North Africa.
meanings.sent1: In some countries, people use dirams to buy things.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for dirams when I visited Morocco.
meanings.sent3: The genie granted him three wishes, but each wish cost him ten dirams.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a thousand dirams to him.
meanings.sent5: The dirams jingled in his pocket, a reminder of his travels.

meanings.definition: A small amount or portion of something.
meanings.sent1: She only had a few dirams left in her savings.
meanings.sent2: He sprinkled a few dirams of salt into the soup for flavor.
meanings.sent3: The cat was content with just a diram of milk in its bowl.
meanings.sent4: His words carried only a diram of truth in a sea of lies.
meanings.sent5: The dirams of sand slipped through his fingers, marking the passage of time.
